intro: Neomanniophyton zenkeri f. dasyanthum, commonly known as the thick-stemmed neomanniophyton, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its robust, woody stems and large, palmate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of hairs. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is typically found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
